# isPlaybackLikelyToKeepUp

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the item will likely play through without stalling.

## Declaration

```swift
nonisolated var isPlaybackLikelyToKeepUp: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

This property communicates a prediction of playability. Factors considered in this prediction include I/O throughput and media decode performance. It is possible for `playbackLikelyToKeepUp` to indicate [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] while the property [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVPlayerItem/isPlaybackBufferFull] indicates [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true]. In this event the playback buffer has reached capacity but there isn’t the statistical data to support a prediction that playback is likely to keep up in the future. It is up to you to decide whether to continue media playback.

## Determining buffering status

- **isPlaybackBufferFull**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the internal media buffer is full and that further I/O is suspended.
- **isPlaybackBufferEmpty**: A Boolean value that indicates whether playback has consumed all buffered media and that playback will stall or end.
